'I don’t even kno what to say. That’s heavy,' Beckham wrote on X

Entertainment Dua Lipa · 11/08/2023

On Wednesday, Odell Beckham Jr., a great wide receiver for the Baltimore Ravens, appeared to discuss the movie "Sound of Freedom."

Beckham wasn't sure how he felt about the film, which also stars Jim Caviezel, Mira Sorvino, and others and tells the tale of Tim Ballard, a former US federal agent who quit his job to devote his life to saving children from sex traffickers, and which puts light on the child trafficking epidemic.

"I have no idea what to say. He noted on X, "That's heavy.

Beckham spent 2022 recovering from an ACL injury he sustained in Super Bowl LVI before joining the Ravens in the offseason.

He is expected to play a significant role in the Baltimore offense.

Despite receiving harsh criticism, the film has amassed more than $150 million at the box office since its premiere

The Guardian, a UK publication, and Jezebel, a website known for pushing far-fetched conspiracy theories, both asserted that the movie was connected to QAnon.

While exposing the underground sex slave trade, the Angel Studios-produced movie never engages in such conspiracies. Nevertheless, both publications linked the movie to extremists in an effort to discredit it and its box office success.

In July, Caviezel fought back against the criticism from the media.

They're terrified. their boots shaking. And it's because people are following their emotions, as this movie encourages them to do, he added.

"The mainstream media is swindling us. No one is covering us," Caviezel remarked. The actor said, "And I'm happy with the two million," alluding to the number of tickets that were bought during the course of the movie's opening weekend. "But I want a lot more, because I want the children."
